success.text: It’s over. You leave before you can regret it, or before you can be caught.

fail.text: Your hand shakes. The act becomes violence instead of mercy, and the story spreads.

outcomes.title: Walk Away
outcomes.desc: You refuse to participate. You refuse to be shaped by them again.

success.text: You walk away. The choice feels clean in the moment, and complicated forever.

fail.text: You walk away and still you’re blamed. Some stories don’t need you present to use your name.

name: Major Event: The First Feast
prompt: The room is full of soft voices and hard eyes, and everyone is pretending this is ordinary. At twenty-five, you’re invited to a modest feast in the capital, the kind thrown by people who desperately want to be seen as established. A toast is raised. A joke cuts too close. A glance lingers on you like a verdict. This is the kind of moment that quietly reshapes a life.

outcomes.title: Charm the Table
outcomes.desc: Turn tension into laughter and make allies without naming them.

success.text: You steer the room away from insult and toward admiration. People remember who saved the evening.

fail.text: Your joke lands wrong. The room goes quiet in a way that feels personal.

outcomes.title: Listen for Leverage
outcomes.desc: While others talk, you learn what they’re afraid of.

success.text: You leave with three useful details and one dangerous one.

fail.text: You’re noticed watching. Someone smiles like they’ve found your weakness.

outcomes.title: Drink Too Deep
outcomes.desc: You drown awkwardness in wine and hope it stays drowned.

success.text: You endure the evening and wake up with only a headache, and a faint sense you missed something important.

fail.text: You say what you shouldn’t. The rumor begins before the cups are cleared.

outcomes.title: Prove Yourself in Sport
outcomes.desc: A sparring ring is cleared. You step in and let the crowd judge your body, not your birth.

success.text: You win cleanly. Applause is a cheap currency, but it spends well.

fail.text: You lose. The laughter is loud, but it fades. The memory doesn’t.

name: Major Event: Road of Knives
prompt: The road is honest in a way courts are not: it tells you the cost up front. On a spring road outside a frontier keep, you find a wagon on its side and three bodies already cooling. The road has grown meaner since you were twenty. Or maybe you’ve just learned how to see it. If you hesitate, the world will decide for you.

outcomes.title: Track the Raiders
outcomes.desc: Follow the bootprints into the trees before rain erases them.

success.text: You find a camp before it moves. You learn how quickly violence becomes routine.

fail.text: You lose the trail, and maybe you never had it. You return with nothing but the smell of blood.

outcomes.title: Loot and Leave
outcomes.desc: The dead won’t spend their coin. You will.

success.text: You take what’s useful and move on fast. The road teaches efficiency.

fail.text: A survivor crawls out and sees your hands in their things. Their scream follows you for miles.

outcomes.title: Give the Dead Names
outcomes.desc: Write down what you can, mark the spot, and notify someone who can bury them.

success.text: It isn’t glamorous, but it’s right. Later, a stranger thanks you with a small favor.

fail.text: No one wants responsibility. Your message is ignored and the bodies become part of the road.

outcomes.title: Set a Warning
outcomes.desc: You drag the wagon into view and carve a sign: “Danger.”

success.text: You make the road safer for others, and angrier for the raiders.

fail.text: Your warning draws attention, just not the kind you wanted.

name: Major Event: The Unexpected Betrothal
prompt: There are rules here that nobody says out loud. You can feel them anyway. A letter arrives with a wax seal you don’t recognize. Inside: an offer of betrothal. It’s not romantic. It’s strategic. Someone thinks you’re worth binding. Whatever you choose, it will be remembered, by the people watching, and by you.

outcomes.title: Accept the Offer
outcomes.desc: You say yes and let the contract make room for love later.

success.text: The acceptance buys you allies you didn’t have yesterday.

fail.text: Your acceptance is treated as presumption. The offer is withdrawn, and the sting lingers.

outcomes.title: Investigate the Suitor
outcomes.desc: Before you say yes or no, you learn what they want, and what they’ve done.

success.text: You uncover a flaw you can use as a bargaining chip.

fail.text: You dig too openly. The suitor learns you were suspicious and takes offense.

outcomes.title: Refuse Cleanly
outcomes.desc: A polite no is still a knife. You place it carefully.

success.text: You keep your freedom, and earn a reputation for stubbornness.

fail.text: The refusal sparks a feud you didn’t mean to start.

outcomes.title: Turn It into Coin
outcomes.desc: You sell the letter to someone who can profit from it.

success.text: You trade future stability for present advantage.

fail.text: Your sale is discovered. People don’t like being treated as merchandise.

name: Major Event: The Trial Ledger
prompt: There are rules here that nobody says out loud. You can feel them anyway. At thirty, you’re no longer ‘promising.’ You’re either “something”… or you’re still waiting. A messenger brings a summons to a toll city: your name has been entered into a trial ledger. If you hesitate, the world will decide for you.

outcomes.title: Defend Yourself in Full
outcomes.desc: You arrive in person, prepared, and make them meet your eyes.

success.text: You speak like someone who belongs in the room. The accusation loses its teeth.

fail.text: The hearing turns into humiliation. The ledger closes with your name under ‘guilty enough.’

outcomes.title: Find the Real Culprit
outcomes.desc: You dig through accounts until the truth is forced into daylight.

success.text: You pull the thread and the whole lie unravels. Someone else is dragged into the light.

fail.text: You dig and hit stone. Someone has paved over the truth.

outcomes.title: Pay to Make It Go Away
outcomes.desc: You slide coin into the right hands and let the ledger lose interest.

success.text: The problem disappears. So does some of your respect for yourself.

fail.text: You pay, and they keep the accusation anyway. Now you’re poorer and still guilty.

outcomes.title: Flee the Summons
outcomes.desc: If you’re going to be judged, you’d rather be judged from a distance.

success.text: You vanish into roads and small inns. The system can’t hold what it can’t find.

fail.text: You’re intercepted. The summons becomes a chain.

name: Major Event: The Physicker’s Price
prompt: Knowledge rarely arrives clean. It comes with missing pages, competing stories, and people who want it buried. At thirty, the body begins to keep receipts. A lingering pain in your side, a cough that returns at night. A traveling physicker offers a diagnosis, and a price. This is the kind of moment that quietly reshapes a life.

outcomes.title: Pay for Treatment
outcomes.desc: You buy medicine, rest, and a chance.

success.text: The physicker’s tinctures taste like bitter hope. Over weeks, the cough eases.

fail.text: You pay, and the treatment fails. You feel the wasted coin like salt in a wound.

outcomes.title: Endure and Work
outcomes.desc: You refuse to slow down. You push through the ache.

success.text: You outlast the worst of it by stubbornness alone.

fail.text: You push too hard. The illness deepens and starts to feel like it has a personality.

outcomes.title: Study the Physicker’s Notes
outcomes.desc: Ask questions. Learn the craft. Make knowledge your medicine.

success.text: You learn enough to treat yourself, and maybe others, before it’s too late.

fail.text: You learn just enough to be afraid. The notes suggest a future you don’t want.

outcomes.title: Steal the Medicine
outcomes.desc: If you can’t afford health, you take it.

success.text: You take the kit and disappear. Your cough improves, and your conscience worsens.

fail.text: You’re caught. The physicker calls you a thief loudly enough for the whole town to hear.

name: Major Event: The Borough Fire
prompt: The room is full of soft voices and hard eyes, and everyone is pretending this is ordinary. A minor fire breaks out in a dense neighborhood. Buckets are passed, screams are swallowed by smoke. You can help, and be seen helping, or you can take advantage of chaos. Whatever you choose, it will be remembered, by the people watching, and by you.

outcomes.title: Organize the Line
outcomes.desc: Turn panic into a plan.

success.text: You place people where they need to be. The fire is contained, and your name rides the relief.

fail.text: You organize and still fail. The fire takes more than it should have.

outcomes.title: Haul and Break
outcomes.desc: You carry water until your arms shake.

success.text: You save a home with your hands. The gratitude is immediate and real.

fail.text: A beam falls. You’re lucky to live.

outcomes.title: Loot the Empty Houses
outcomes.desc: Chaos is a curtain. You move behind it.

success.text: You leave with a bag of silver and a stain you won’t wash out.

fail.text: A homeowner catches you and screams your name into the smoke.

outcomes.title: Save the Records
outcomes.desc: You prioritize the ledger-boxes and deeds, what keeps families from becoming nothing.

success.text: You pull papers from flame like they’re children. Later, people thank you with favors.

fail.text: The records burn despite you. In the ashes, someone blames you for choosing paper over people.

name: Major Event: The Returned Debt
prompt: This is how traps work: they look like opportunities until they close. At forty, a debt you thought buried claws its way back up. A collector presents a note in your handwriting. You don’t remember writing it. That doesn’t matter. This is the kind of moment that quietly reshapes a life.

outcomes.title: Pay the Debt
outcomes.desc: You swallow pride and pay for peace.

success.text: Coin leaves your hand and some of your fear leaves with it.

fail.text: You pay and still they press. The debt was never about coin.

outcomes.title: Challenge the Note
outcomes.desc: Find a forgery, find a loophole, find a way out.

success.text: You prove the signature false. The collector leaves, grudgingly.

fail.text: You can’t crack it. The note is too good, or you’re being played by someone better.

outcomes.title: Buy Time with Threats
outcomes.desc: You make it dangerous to collect from you.

success.text: The collector steps back. Fear is a currency too.

fail.text: They’re not afraid of you. They’re afraid of whoever sent them, and that makes you small.

outcomes.title: Make Them Disappear
outcomes.desc: If the debt is a person, remove the person.

success.text: The collector doesn’t return. The debt doesn’t go away, it just changes shape.

fail.text: The attempt fails and becomes a new charge.

name: Major Event: The Sick Harvest
prompt: The road is honest in a way courts are not: it tells you the cost up front. A harvest sickness spreads in the villages outside a lakeside city. The granaries smell wrong. If you act, you might save people. If you act poorly, you might be blamed for the hunger. Whatever you choose, it will be remembered, by the people watching, and by you.

outcomes.title: Quarantine the Grain
outcomes.desc: Stop distribution until it can be tested.

success.text: You hold firm. There’s anger, but fewer graves.

fail.text: People break quarantine. The sickness spreads through desperation.

outcomes.title: Find the Cause
outcomes.desc: Inspect the stores, question millers, follow the rot.

success.text: You find tainted barrels, and a supplier who knew. The lie is smaller than the hunger, but still a lie.

fail.text: You can’t find the hinge. Everyone points at everyone else and nothing changes.

outcomes.title: Hire Guards for the Granary
outcomes.desc: Keep the peace with steel.

success.text: You prevent a riot. The villagers hate you for it today and thank you for it later, maybe.

fail.text: The riot happens anyway, and you’re in the middle of it.

outcomes.title: Profit from Shortage
outcomes.desc: Buy low, sell high, and let hunger be someone else’s problem.

success.text: Your purse grows heavy. Your name grows heavy too, but in a different way.

fail.text: You’re caught with grain in your cart while children go without.

name: Major Event: The Veteran’s Lessons
prompt: It starts as a problem you can’t talk your way out of, and it escalates faster than you’d like. A hardened veteran offers to teach you (or your household) the ‘real’ lessons of survival: how to kill, how to endure, how to take. At forty, you choose what kind of example you are. If you hesitate, the world will decide for you.

outcomes.title: Train with Them
outcomes.desc: You take bruises now to avoid graves later.

success.text: You feel younger for a week. Then you feel the bruises for a month.

fail.text: You overdo it. A joint pops wrong and stays wrong.

outcomes.title: Pay for Their Loyalty
outcomes.desc: You hire them as a standing guard.

success.text: Coin turns into safety, at least until it runs out.

fail.text: You pay, and the veteran leaves anyway. Loyalty purchased is loyalty rented.

outcomes.title: Learn Their Stories
outcomes.desc: You ask what they saw, what broke them, and what they regret.

success.text: You learn how war shapes a person. The knowledge is ugly and useful.

fail.text: They shut down. Some doors are welded shut from the inside.

outcomes.title: Turn Them Away
outcomes.desc: You refuse violence as a household craft.

success.text: You choose gentler rituals. It doesn’t make the world gentler, but it makes you consistent.

fail.text: The veteran laughs and calls you naive, loudly enough for others to hear.

name: Major Event: The Merger Proposal
prompt: There are rules here that nobody says out loud. You can feel them anyway. At forty-five, the people who once called you ‘friend’ now call you ‘competitor.’ A proposal arrives: combine households, merge accounts, share a future. It’s safer… and it’s a trap. This is the kind of moment that quietly reshapes a life.

outcomes.title: Agree to the Merger
outcomes.desc: You tie your fate to theirs and hope it holds.

success.text: The agreement stabilizes your position. For now, the world feels less sharp.

fail.text: The merger becomes a choke chain. You realize too late who is pulling.

outcomes.title: Read the Fine Print
outcomes.desc: You comb the proposal for the hidden blade.

success.text: You find the trap and rewrite it. They sign anyway, because they need you.

fail.text: You miss one clause. That one clause is enough.

outcomes.title: Sabotage Them First
outcomes.desc: If it’s a trap, you’d rather be the one setting it.

success.text: You leak just enough to make their position wobble. It’s cruel. It works.

fail.text: They anticipated betrayal. Now you’re the villain in a story they tell better than you do.

outcomes.title: Refuse and Prepare
outcomes.desc: You say no, then brace for retaliation.

success.text: You refuse cleanly and set your household on alert. You feel the future tightening like a bowstring.

fail.text: Retaliation comes fast. The refusal becomes a feud.

name: Major Event: The Old Enemy
prompt: The room is full of soft voices and hard eyes, and everyone is pretending this is ordinary. An old enemy resurfaces, someone you wronged or someone who believes you did. They arrive with witnesses. They want satisfaction, apology, or blood. At forty-five, you don’t have the luxury of being careless. There’s no clean path here, only tradeoffs you can live with.

outcomes.title: Offer a Public Apology
outcomes.desc: You kneel, speak, and hope humility is stronger than vengeance.

success.text: The apology is real. The crowd feels it. Your enemy hesitates, and that hesitation is a crack.

fail.text: They reject your apology and call it theater. The crowd laughs, and you feel the old shame return.

outcomes.title: Settle It with Steel
outcomes.desc: You accept a duel, a trial by combat, a clean ending.

success.text: You win. The enemy falls. The story ends, at least this version of it.

fail.text: You lose. The enemy doesn’t kill you, but the wound changes how you move afterward.

outcomes.title: Unmake Their Witnesses
outcomes.desc: Find what the witnesses fear and let them fear it.

success.text: The witnesses arrive less confident. Their story frays under pressure.

fail.text: Your pressure is noticed. Suddenly you look guilty, even if you aren’t.

outcomes.title: Prove Them Wrong with Records
outcomes.desc: You produce documents, dates, and names until the accusation collapses.

success.text: The accusation falls apart under facts. The enemy leaves with nothing but bitterness.

fail.text: One record contradicts another. The truth becomes muddy, and mud favors whoever shouts loudest.

name: Major Event: The Snowbound Inn
prompt: The road is honest in a way courts are not: it tells you the cost up front. A midwinter storm traps you and a small company in an inn on the road. Everyone is hungry. Everyone is armed. A bag of coin goes missing. The details will blur later. The decision won’t.

outcomes.title: Investigate Quietly
outcomes.desc: You ask gentle questions and watch hands, not faces.

success.text: You find the thief, or you find proof enough to choose one.

fail.text: Your questions make people defensive. The inn turns colder.

outcomes.title: Impose Order
outcomes.desc: You take control of the room before the room takes control of itself.

success.text: You set rules and enforce them. The night stays tense, but it stays contained.

fail.text: Someone challenges you in front of everyone. You lose the room, and the night becomes dangerous.

outcomes.title: Steal the Blame
outcomes.desc: You point the room at someone else and let the mob do the rest.

success.text: The accusation sticks. The thief escapes into the shadows, possibly you, possibly not.

fail.text: The room realizes you manipulated them. The mood turns ugly fast.

outcomes.title: Pay Everyone Back
outcomes.desc: You cover the loss to keep peace and pride intact.

success.text: You spend coin and buy a quiet night. Sometimes that’s a victory.

fail.text: You pay and still someone accuses you. Coin can’t buy trust from people who want blood.

name: Collector’s Knock
prompt: In a toll city’s shadowed arcade, a man with a neat ledger finds you. Two quiet companions stand close enough to make their meaning plain.

outcomes.title: Pay in Coin
outcomes.desc: You swallow pride and pay what you can, now, before the crowd notices.

success.text: You count the coins into his palm. He nods once, no warmth, no malice, and vanishes into the market’s churn.

fail.text: You fumble, argue, and draw eyes. The collector takes what you offer and leaves you with the taste of ridicule.

outcomes.title: Renegotiate Terms
outcomes.desc: You argue the ledger, the dates, the witnesses, make it sound like they’ve erred.

success.text: You find a crack in the ink and press until it widens. The collector’s jaw tightens, then he scratches a new line: lesser terms… for now.

fail.text: He smiles as you speak. When you finish, he taps the page and the smile becomes pity.

outcomes.title: Offer a Service
outcomes.desc: You trade labor and discretion for time, an ugly bargain dressed as courtesy.

success.text: You leave with a task, not a bruised purse. The collector’s people stop following, for the moment.

fail.text: You offer too much, too eagerly. The collector smells desperation and raises the terms with a shrug.

outcomes.title: Drive Them Off
outcomes.desc: You make it clear you won’t be tallied like a crate of saltfish.

success.text: The collector backs away first. He does not run, but his eyes promise you’ll be written into a different ledger.

fail.text: You lunge. They’re quicker than they look.

name: Seizure Notice
prompt: A wax-sealed notice is pressed into your hand at a banking city: goods and wages, present and future, are named as collateral. It is written politely.

outcomes.title: Sell Something Dear
outcomes.desc: You part with an heirloom, a weapon, a ring, something you told yourself you’d keep.

success.text: You make the sale and feel lighter in the purse and heavier in the chest. The notice is satisfied, on paper, at least.

fail.text: You find no buyer worth trusting. The best offers smell of theft and laughter.

outcomes.title: Hide Your Assets
outcomes.desc: You move coin and goods where ledgers cannot reach.

success.text: Your wealth becomes smoke, present, but hard to grasp. The seizure comes up short.

fail.text: A watcher sees too much. By nightfall, your hiding place is already known.

outcomes.title: Appeal to a Patron
outcomes.desc: You ask someone important to vouch for you, publicly, painfully.

success.text: A signature joins your name. The notice is amended, softened, delayed.

fail.text: No one answers. Or they answer with silence.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Seizure
outcomes.desc: You tear the notice and dare them to enforce it.

success.text: The paper shreds. So does your place in polite order.

fail.text: Hands seize you first. The notice is read aloud.

name: A Desperate Commission
prompt: In a frontier keep, a messenger offers quick coin for a quick errand, no questions, no witnesses, no delays. The sort of work that makes honest folk look away.

outcomes.title: Do the Work Clean
outcomes.desc: You keep your hands as clean as the job allows.

success.text: You deliver the parcel and keep your eyes forward. The coin is real.

fail.text: You hesitate at the wrong moment. The parcel is taken from you, and you are left with only suspicion.

outcomes.title: Cut Corners
outcomes.desc: You take the faster road and trust luck to cover the rest.

success.text: You arrive early and unseen. The pay is smaller than promised, but enough to breathe.

fail.text: You arrive early, straight into a patrol. The parcel becomes evidence in someone else’s story.

outcomes.title: Take a Second Cut
outcomes.desc: If the job is dirty, you may as well profit twice.

success.text: You skim what you can and leave no obvious sign. The coin weight in your pocket is almost comforting.

fail.text: Someone notices the missing weight. The messenger’s smile turns thin.

outcomes.title: Refuse and Beg Time
outcomes.desc: You try to talk your way into mercy instead of money.

success.text: You leave with no coin, but with a promised delay. It is not kindness.

fail.text: No one buys your sob story. Your refusal is noted, and the note will travel.

name: Contract Court
prompt: You are summoned to a low hall where ink rules more cruelly than steel. A clerk reads your debt as if it were a prayer.

outcomes.title: Speak Plainly
outcomes.desc: You admit what you must and ask for terms you can survive.

success.text: You leave with a schedule instead of a sentence. It will still hurt, but it is bearable.

fail.text: Plain speech becomes plain weakness. The clerk writes harsher terms without looking you in the eye.

outcomes.title: Find a Flaw
outcomes.desc: You hunt for a technicality, some missing seal, some wrong date.

success.text: A missing witness mark saves you. The clerk hisses through his teeth as he alters the record.

fail.text: You argue like a lawyer and lose like a peasant. The room laughs softly.

outcomes.title: Bribe the Clerk
outcomes.desc: You grease the ink and hope the ink remembers you kindly.

success.text: The clerk pockets your offering and stamps a new copy. Your debt shrinks… and your shame grows.

fail.text: He takes your coin and calls for the bailiff. You learn how quickly a quiet hall can become a cage.

outcomes.title: Make a Scene
outcomes.desc: You turn the hall’s attention into a weapon.

success.text: Your voice carries. The hall shifts.

fail.text: Hands seize you. Inksplattered shame follows.

name: Flee the Ledger
prompt: At a scholar's town, fog hangs like a curtain and the road beyond feels like forgetting. You could leave your debt behind.

outcomes.title: Slip Away Quietly
outcomes.desc: You leave before dawn, taking only what you can carry.

success.text: You are a rumor by midday. The ledger cannot chase what it cannot name, yet.

fail.text: You are stopped on the road and asked questions you cannot answer cleanly.

outcomes.title: Buy a New Name
outcomes.desc: You pay for false papers and the mercy of strangers.

success.text: Ink becomes armor. Your old name remains on the ledger; your new one walks free.

fail.text: The papers are flawed. The first person who reads them reads you, too.

outcomes.title: Face It Instead
outcomes.desc: You stay. You endure the shame. You try to build back from within the rules.

success.text: You swallow the bitter thing and do not choke. The road remains open, if narrower than before.

fail.text: You stay, and the city stays hungry. It takes what it can from you and calls it order.

outcomes.title: Burn the Record
outcomes.desc: You aim to destroy the ledger itself.

success.text: Fire eats ink. For a heartbeat, you feel clean.

fail.text: You reach for the ledger and find a knife instead. Pain is immediate.

name: The Rumor Mill
prompt: You hear your own name spoken with a laugh that stops when you look over. Rumors run ahead of you in a toll city like rats.

outcomes.title: Apologize in Public
outcomes.desc: You make a show of humility before the right eyes.

success.text: You bow, you speak, you swallow pride. The crowd finds it hard to hate someone who bleeds so openly.

fail.text: Your apology sounds rehearsed. People do not forgive performances; they forgive wounds.

outcomes.title: Plant a Better Story
outcomes.desc: You feed the gossips something tastier than the truth.

success.text: By dusk, the tale has changed. Not cleaner, just pointed elsewhere.

fail.text: Someone catches the seam in your lie and tugs until it unravels.

outcomes.title: Endure in Silence
outcomes.desc: You keep your chin up and let time do its slow work.

success.text: You do not flinch. Some admire that.

fail.text: Silence is mistaken for guilt. The whispers grow bolder.

outcomes.title: Pick a Fight
outcomes.desc: You choose one loudmouth and make an example.

success.text: The room goes quiet. Fear can look like respect from the right angle.

fail.text: You swing and miss. Someone else lands the real blow, on your reputation.

name: Notice of Hearing
prompt: A formal notice arrives: you are invited, no, required, to appear and answer for yourself. The ink is crisp.

outcomes.title: Show Contrition
outcomes.desc: You give them a penitent face and a careful story.

success.text: You speak of regret without begging for love. The hall, grudgingly, accepts the shape of your remorse.

fail.text: Your contrition sounds like self-pity. The hall grows cold.

outcomes.title: Bring Evidence
outcomes.desc: You come armed with dates, witnesses, and inconvenient facts.

success.text: Ink fights ink. For once, yours holds.

fail.text: Your evidence is dismissed as cleverness. Cleverness is not the same as innocence, at least not here.

outcomes.title: Buy a Witness
outcomes.desc: You pay for someone to remember things differently.

success.text: The witness speaks with trembling conviction. The hall nods along, pleased to be told what it wants to hear.

fail.text: The witness cracks. Under questions, the paid words spill into a confession that drags you with it.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Hearing
outcomes.desc: You do not appear. Let them judge an empty chair.

success.text: You walk away before they can cage you in ceremony. The city will call it guilt.

fail.text: They find you anyway. Refusal becomes an additional charge, and the charge becomes a chain.

name: Service in Shadows
prompt: A small hospice on the Verdant Road takes in the unwanted. No one asks your name, only what your hands can do.

outcomes.title: Do the Hard Work
outcomes.desc: You scrub floors, carry water, and accept every unglamorous task.

success.text: Day by day, the stain dulls. A few travelers leave speaking of your steadiness instead of your shame.

fail.text: You try, but pride keeps finding your hands. Someone notices and shakes their head.

outcomes.title: Tend the Sick
outcomes.desc: You learn what hurts others, and hope it teaches you what hurt you caused.

success.text: You speak softly, work carefully, and earn quiet gratitude. No one calls you saint, but they stop calling you villain.

fail.text: You make a mistake. It isn’t cruel, only careless, but careless ruins lives too.

outcomes.title: Make a Quiet Donation
outcomes.desc: You buy goodwill the way the powerful do: without asking permission.

success.text: Coin changes hands; so does narrative. The hospice speaks well of you, and the road carries that kindness outward.

fail.text: Your gift is taken as hush money. The worst interpretations bloom like mold.

outcomes.title: Steal a Little Peace
outcomes.desc: If the world won’t give you grace, you’ll take something else.

success.text: You skim what you can without harming the sick. The hospice never notices.

fail.text: Caught. The word spreads faster than your shame ever did, because people love to be proven right.

name: Duel of Repute
prompt: A rival offers you a choice: accept a formal duel, of steel or of words, or be remembered forever as the one who declined. Sometimes redemption is just risk with better clothing.

outcomes.title: Duel with Steel
outcomes.desc: You meet them blade-to-blade where everyone can see.

success.text: You win cleanly and stop short of cruelty. The crowd exhales; the story changes in its telling.

fail.text: You lose, and the world treats it like proof. Pain is temporary.

outcomes.title: Duel with Words
outcomes.desc: You let wit and composure do what your blade cannot.

success.text: You turn their accusations into their own embarrassment. Some applause is genuine.

fail.text: You stumble on a phrase and they pounce. The hall laughs again, and you feel the stain deepen.

outcomes.title: Fight Dirty
outcomes.desc: You win by any means that ends the conversation.

success.text: A whispered truth, a hidden blade, a sudden shove, whatever it was, it worked. The duel ends.

fail.text: Your trick fails. Now you’re not only shamed, you’re caught.

outcomes.title: Decline and Leave
outcomes.desc: You refuse the stage and take your chances elsewhere.

success.text: You walk away from the crowd’s hunger. The stain doesn’t vanish, but it stops growing.

fail.text: They spit after you. The story hardens.

name: Rite of Atonement
prompt: In a small roadside chapel, an elder offers a ritual meant for the shamed: a public confession, a private penance, or a gift to those you wronged. It will not erase the past.

outcomes.title: Confess Publicly
outcomes.desc: You speak your faults aloud where gossip can’t twist them further.

success.text: You confess without theater. The room grows quiet, then oddly gentle.

fail.text: Your confession turns into justification. The elder’s face hardens.

outcomes.title: Take Private Penance
outcomes.desc: You do the work without the spectacle: fasting, labor, and silence.

success.text: A week passes with sore hands and calmer thoughts. When you return to the road, you stand straighter.

fail.text: You try to endure, but you break early. You learn that quitting hurts twice: once in body, once in story.

outcomes.title: Buy Reparations
outcomes.desc: You pay what you can to those harmed by your name.

success.text: Coin cannot mend everything. But it can mend enough that some people stop wishing you ill.

fail.text: Your reparations are taken as mockery, too little, too late, too convenient. The road carries the insult onward.

outcomes.title: Forge a Cleansing Story
outcomes.desc: You invent a narrative so pious it becomes hard to question.

success.text: The tale spreads: tragedy, misunderstanding, cruel rivals. People love a simple story.

fail.text: Someone from your past is in the chapel and hears every word. Their laughter is quiet, and devastating.

name: Misstep on Wet Stones
prompt: Rain slicks the old stones. One careless step sends you down hard.

outcomes.title: Laugh It Off
outcomes.desc: You rise quickly and keep moving, pretending it didn’t hurt.

success.text: You grit your teeth and carry on. Pride holds you upright.

fail.text: You push too hard and feel something wrench. The ache deepens into something worse.

outcomes.title: Bind It Properly
outcomes.desc: You take the time to wrap and brace before you travel.

success.text: A careful binding keeps the worst of the pain at bay. You move slower, but safer.

fail.text: Your wrapping slips, and you spend the day fighting it. Fatigue settles into your bones.

outcomes.title: Find a Handhold
outcomes.desc: You look for a safer route and a steadier footing.

success.text: You take the long way and avoid a worse fall. Still, you don’t escape entirely unmarked.

fail.text: You misjudge the detour and lose time and supplies to the mud.

outcomes.title: Leap the Gap
outcomes.desc: You choose speed over sense.

success.text: You clear it with a jolt of pain and a grin you don’t quite mean.

fail.text: Your foot slips at the edge. You hit the stone like a bell struck too hard.

name: Sparring Mishap
prompt: A friendly spar turns sharp. A wooden blade catches you in the wrong place, and the room goes quiet for a heartbeat.

outcomes.title: Shake It Out
outcomes.desc: You insist you’re fine and demand they continue.

success.text: You force your body to obey. The lesson is learned in pain.

fail.text: You overextend and something tears. Pride turns into regret.

outcomes.title: Take the Lesson
outcomes.desc: You step back, breathe, and let the spar end with dignity.

success.text: You swallow embarrassment and keep your body intact.

fail.text: Your restraint is taken as weakness. The jeers sting worse than the bruise.

outcomes.title: Study the Footwork
outcomes.desc: You watch instead of swing, learn what you can without risking more pain.

success.text: You learn a thing or two while your body recovers.

fail.text: You miss the rhythm of the bout. The lesson slips away.

outcomes.title: Cheat a Little
outcomes.desc: A hidden shove, a tripped foot, nothing a crowd can swear to.

success.text: You ‘win’ and keep face. The bruise still blooms beneath your sleeve.

fail.text: Caught. The spar ends in real anger.

name: Herbal Poultice
prompt: A hedge-healer offers a poultice that smells like crushed leaves and bitter sap. “It won’t make you young,” she says.

outcomes.title: Pay for the Poultice
outcomes.desc: Coin is easier to spend than patience.

success.text: The poultice burns, then cools. By morning, the ache has backed away.

fail.text: You pay and still fumble the care. The poultice helps, but not enough.

outcomes.title: Brew It Yourself
outcomes.desc: You trust your own hands more than hers.

success.text: You mix the herbs with careful intent. The pain loosens its grip.

fail.text: You misjudge the mixture. The skin reddens and your temper follows.

outcomes.title: Endure Without Help
outcomes.desc: You let the bruise run its course.

success.text: You rest when you can and push only when you must. The bruise fades on its own time.

fail.text: You push when you should rest. The ache sharpens into a true injury.

outcomes.title: Hide the Pain
outcomes.desc: You mask it with posture, charm, and a careful sleeve.

success.text: No one notices, and that is a kind of victory. The bruise remains, but it stops ruling you.

fail.text: Someone notices anyway. The pity in their eyes is worse than the pain.

name: Sheltered Rest
prompt: A warm inn and a clean pallet are offered, at a price. Rest is its own resource, and you are running low.

outcomes.title: Pay for a Night’s Rest
outcomes.desc: You buy comfort and a little time.

success.text: A night of sleep does what heroics cannot. You wake steadier.

fail.text: You pay, but the room is noisy and the mattress lumpy. Rest comes in scraps.

outcomes.title: Barter Work for Bed
outcomes.desc: You sweep, chop, or scrub in exchange for shelter.

success.text: You earn your rest honestly. The pain fades with the dawn.

fail.text: You work until you shake, and the bruise remains stubborn as a curse.

outcomes.title: Sleep Outside
outcomes.desc: You save coin and pay in discomfort.

success.text: It isn’t pleasant, but it’s enough. The bruise loosens.

fail.text: Cold seeps into your bones. You wake worse than you lay down.

outcomes.title: Pick a Fight for Pride
outcomes.desc: You refuse to look weak, especially to strangers.

success.text: You win a brief scuffle and keep face. The bruise remains, but fear gives you a little room to breathe.

fail.text: The fight turns uglier than you meant. You limp away with something worse than a bruise.

name: Cough in the Candlelight
prompt: At a warm hall-table in the central marches, laughter rises with the smoke. Then someone coughs, once, twice, wet and ugly.

outcomes.title: Stay and Play It Strong
outcomes.desc: Keep appearances. If you look afraid, the rumor will eat you before any fever does.

success.text: You remain all poise and quiet authority, speaking only when necessary. People follow your lead, and panic never quite catches.

fail.text: You force yourself to stay, to smile through the stink of smoke and sickness. The next day your throat burns and your joints ache.

outcomes.title: Slip Out Before Dawn
outcomes.desc: Leave quietly, while the doors still open and names aren't being taken.

success.text: You vanish in the hour when even guards are tired. Later you hear who fell ill, and who denied it.

fail.text: A servant sees you go and whispers to the wrong ear. By noon, your absence has a shape: 'cowardice'.

outcomes.title: Offer Practical Help
outcomes.desc: If it spreads, contain it, water boiled, cloths changed, beds separated.

success.text: You organize hands and habits. When the worst passes, people speak of you in the same breath as 'sense'.

fail.text: You try to help, and still you touch the wrong cup, breathe the wrong air. The work is honest, but the fever doesn't care.

name: Fogwater Ford
prompt: The ford is shallow, but the fog is thick and the water bites like teeth. By the far bank, your boots are stones and your breath comes out wrong.

outcomes.title: Cross Fast, Don't Think
outcomes.desc: Get through before your courage has time to argue.

success.text: You grit your teeth and keep moving. Cold becomes a thing behind you.

fail.text: Your foot slips; you go down hard and swallow river-water. You get up, but the cough stays with you like a debt.

outcomes.title: Find a Higher Crossing
outcomes.desc: Lose time now to avoid paying for it later.

success.text: You trace the fog's edge until you find stones set like a half-remembered path. It costs time, but you keep your health, and even spot a patch of winter herbs.

fail.text: You wander too long. The cold creeps into your bones anyway, and by the time you cross you're tired in the marrow.

outcomes.title: Make Camp and Warm Up
outcomes.desc: Stop. Build a small fire. Let your body forgive you.

success.text: The fire is miserable and small, but it is enough. You cross later with steady breath.

fail.text: The wood is wet and your patience isn't. You burn supplies and time and still feel the cold in your joints.

name: Physicker’s Bitter Draft
prompt: In a back lane that smells of crushed herbs and old wine, a physicker offers you a cup the color of swampwater. "It will help," she says.

outcomes.title: Pay for Proper Care
outcomes.desc: Clean linens, heated stones, and bitter medicine, no shortcuts.

success.text: Coin buys time, warmth, and someone to change the cloth before it turns. The fever breaks in a single night, leaving you weak but alive.

fail.text: You pay, and still the physicker shrugs. "Bodies are stubborn," she says.

outcomes.title: Endure the Folk Remedy
outcomes.desc: A poultice of garlic and ash, and a lot of faith.

success.text: It tastes like regret, but you swallow it anyway. The fever loosens its grip, and your lungs remember how to be lungs.

fail.text: You sweat through the night, drifting in and out of ugly dreams. When you wake, you are not worse, but you're not better either.

outcomes.title: Trade a Favor for the Cure
outcomes.desc: You offer a secret, a debt, a promise, anything that isn't coin.

success.text: You speak softly and pay in a different currency. The physicker nods once, and the next draught she hands you is the real thing.

fail.text: You offer leverage and get laughed out of the lane. Illness doesn't respect negotiation.

name: Borrowed Bed
prompt: A roadside widow keeps a spare cot in her loft. It's clean enough.

outcomes.title: Pay for a Night’s Rest
outcomes.desc: Sleep with your boots off. Let the world keep turning without you.

success.text: You sleep like stone and wake like a person again. The widow asks nothing more than the coin and a quiet goodbye.

fail.text: You pay, but sleep doesn't come. Every creak sounds like a threat; every shadow is a hand.

outcomes.title: Work for the Cot
outcomes.desc: Split wood, fix a hinge, carry water. Earn the right to be still.

success.text: You work until your hands sting, and then you sleep. The widow tells her neighbor you were 'respectable', which is its own kind of armor.

fail.text: You slip on a wet plank and bang your shoulder hard. The widow still lets you sleep, but pain shares the cot.

outcomes.title: Move On
outcomes.desc: Better tired than tangled in someone else’s rumors.

success.text: You keep walking. You also keep your name clean.

fail.text: You keep walking until the stars blur. By morning, your legs are treason.

name: Three Sleepless Nights
prompt: Your mind won't close. Every time you blink, a new worry opens its mouth.

outcomes.title: Write It All Down
outcomes.desc: If the thoughts won't stop, trap them on parchment.

success.text: You bleed your anxieties into ink. By dawn, the page holds them, and your mind is quieter.

fail.text: You write until your hand cramps, but the thoughts keep coming. When you finally sleep, it's shallow and mean.

outcomes.title: Drink to Forget
outcomes.desc: A mug. Then another. Let the world go soft at the edges.

success.text: The drink drags you down into a thick, dreamless night. You wake groggy, but you did wake.

fail.text: You drink and drink and still the thoughts gnaw. In the morning, you have a headache and a reputation.

outcomes.title: Force Discipline
outcomes.desc: Breathe. Count. Reset the mind like a blade honed on stone.

success.text: You wrestle your thoughts into order. It is not peace, but it is control.

fail.text: You strain until your jaw aches and your eyes burn. The stress breaks something small inside you.

name: Wrong Face at the Gate
prompt: A watchman squints at you under the gatehouse lantern. "Hold," he says.

outcomes.title: Talk Your Way Past
outcomes.desc: Make your voice sound like it belongs here.

success.text: You smile, you nod, you speak the right names. The watchman hesitates, and lets you through.

fail.text: You say one name wrong. The lantern light hardens.

outcomes.title: Slip Away Into the Crowd
outcomes.desc: Become a different person for a few heartbeats.

success.text: You melt into moving bodies, a cloak among cloaks. Later you learn whose face you were wearing, and why that was dangerous.

fail.text: A child points. A dog barks.

outcomes.title: Push Through
outcomes.desc: If you hesitate, you're caught. If you don't, maybe you're bold enough to be innocent.

success.text: You shoulder past the watchman and hit the street like a thrown stone. For a moment you are unstoppable.

fail.text: You hit the gate like a bull and pay for it like a man. The watchman's cudgel finds your ribs, and the bell finds your name.

name: False Papers, True Ink
prompt: A scrivener with ink-stained fingers offers a new name, written clean, sealed well, and just plausible enough to fool a tired guard.

outcomes.title: Pay for the Papers
outcomes.desc: A name with no past is still expensive.

success.text: You walk out with a new name in your pocket and an old one buried under lies. It isn’t honorable, but it is breathable.

fail.text: The seal is wrong; the ink smears. The scrivener shrugs and vanishes into the alley.

outcomes.title: Threaten the Scrivener
outcomes.desc: If you can't afford lies, take them.

success.text: You make your meaning clear. The scrivener’s hands shake as he writes, but the work is good.

fail.text: You reach for the scrivener and find a knife instead. He slips away bleeding, and your name gets sharper in the telling.

outcomes.title: Trade a Secret
outcomes.desc: Give him something he can sell later.

success.text: You whisper a truth that shouldn't have an audience. The scrivener smiles like a merchant and hands you your new life.

fail.text: You offer a secret and get measured for its value. The scrivener decides you are worth more hunted than helped.

name: Bounty Hunters Close In
prompt: You feel them before you see them: the quiet absence of casual conversation, the way doors close one breath too early. Then, on a narrow road, three riders appear behind you, patient as debt.

outcomes.title: Lose Them in the Brush
outcomes.desc: Take the hard ground and make it your ally.

success.text: You disappear into thorns and wet earth, emerging later scraped but free. The riders pass you by, cursing the road.

fail.text: A branch catches your cloak; a horse catches your shadow. You escape, but not cleanly.

outcomes.title: Buy Them Off
outcomes.desc: Gold is louder than justice when no one is watching.

success.text: You meet them on the road and speak like a man who can pay. They agree, because they were never there for honor in the first place.

fail.text: Your coin is counted and found wanting. They take it anyway, and now they also take your time.

outcomes.title: Turn and Fight
outcomes.desc: If you run, you die tired. Better to die loud.

success.text: You break one rider and send another limping. The third decides you are too expensive to claim.

fail.text: Steel meets steel, and your body remembers it is made of meat. You live, but you pay.

name: Forage in the Greenfold
prompt: Your stomach makes arguments your pride can't answer. The central marches’s hedgerows are thick with life, some of it edible, some of it eager to punish the ignorant.

outcomes.title: Forage Carefully
outcomes.desc: Take only what you can name. Leave the rest for the crows.

success.text: You find bitter roots and a handful of nuts, enough to silence the worst of the hunger. It isn't a feast, but it keeps the road from winning.

fail.text: You eat what looks safe and regret it within the hour. Your belly knots and your throat goes raw.

outcomes.title: Set a Snare
outcomes.desc: If you're patient, the forest will pay you back.

success.text: At dusk you return to find a fat rabbit in the loop. Hunger quiets.

fail.text: You catch nothing but your own fingers and a thorn. Hunger stays loud.

outcomes.title: Beg at a Farm Gate
outcomes.desc: Ask for bread with your hands open and your eyes down.

success.text: A farmer’s wife watches you for a long moment, then presses a heel of bread into your palm. You eat with shame, and you live.

fail.text: The gate stays shut. Someone laughs from behind it.

name: Soup Line at Wrenfield
prompt: a hard-bitten town’s chapel offers thin soup to anyone willing to queue under the eyes of the righteous. You can smell it from the street.

outcomes.title: Take the Bowl
outcomes.desc: Let them stare. You’re still alive.

success.text: The soup is mostly water, but it is warm and real. Shame is not fatal, despite what pride insists.

fail.text: You reach the front, and the pot runs dry. The disappointment hits you like a punch.

outcomes.title: Volunteer Instead
outcomes.desc: Earn your meal with your hands and keep a shred of dignity.

success.text: You haul water and chop onions until your eyes burn. When you finally sit, the soup tastes like victory.

fail.text: You work, but the overseer finds fault in you that isn't there. You still eat, barely, but the kindness comes with a hook.

outcomes.title: Steal a Ladle
outcomes.desc: If mercy is rationed, take your share.

success.text: Your hand is quick. The ladle is hot, and so is the guilt, but you eat.

fail.text: You’re caught with soup on your sleeve. Hunger turns into a public lesson.

name: Bandage and Bone
prompt: A traveling surgeon sets up near a wagon, his tools laid out like cutlery. He looks at your wound and hums.

outcomes.title: Pay the Surgeon
outcomes.desc: Clean stitches and pain you can trust.

success.text: Coin buys competence. The stitching is quick, and the bandage is tight.

fail.text: The surgeon takes your coin and does what he can. It's not enough to make you whole, but it keeps you from rotting.

outcomes.title: Endure Field Treatment
outcomes.desc: Let him work. Don't flinch. Don't scream.

success.text: You bite down on cloth and take it. When it's done, the wound is angry but contained.

fail.text: The pain breaks your focus and the work goes rough. Days later the wound is swollen and hot.

outcomes.title: Walk Away
outcomes.desc: You’ve survived so far. Maybe you'll keep surviving.

success.text: You keep moving. The surgeon shrugs; he's seen stubborn before.

fail.text: You move, and the wound complains loudly. Not yet fatal, but eager to become so.

name: Training Yard Mishap
prompt: A friendly bout turns sour when someone misjudges distance, or pride, or both. Steel kisses flesh, and suddenly the world is all bright pain.

outcomes.title: Push Through the Pain
outcomes.desc: If you stop, you lose face. If you continue, you might lose more.

success.text: You finish the bout on sheer will. People cheer.

fail.text: You push too hard and fall wrong. The crowd goes quiet.

outcomes.title: Yield Gracefully
outcomes.desc: Call it before it becomes a story told at your expense.

success.text: You step back, raise a hand, and concede with dignity. It's a small loss that saves a larger one.

fail.text: You yield, and someone laughs anyway. You swallow it, but it lodges in your throat.

outcomes.title: End It Quickly
outcomes.desc: A sudden lunge, a decisive strike. No room for accidents.

success.text: You move like you meant it, and the bout ends before it turns cruel. Some call it efficient.

fail.text: You overcommit. Someone goes down hard and doesn't get up fast enough.

name: Collector’s Knock
prompt: A runner finds you with practiced ease. "My master remembers your arrangement," she says, smiling like a knife.

outcomes.title: Pay Something Now
outcomes.desc: Not all of it, just enough to keep the knives in their sheaths.

success.text: You pay what you can. The runner counts it, nods, and leaves.

fail.text: You offer coin and excuses. The runner takes the coin and leaves the excuses on the floor.

outcomes.title: Offer Service Instead
outcomes.desc: If you can't pay with coin, pay with time.

success.text: You write, you carry, you observe, small tasks with sharp edges. The runner returns later with a receipt and a warning: "Don't do this twice."

fail.text: Your 'service' is noted, then declined. The debt is not impressed by your creativity.

outcomes.title: Hide From the Knock
outcomes.desc: If they can’t find you, they can’t collect.

success.text: You vanish into alleys and borrowed doors. The runner leaves empty-handed, and you keep breathing.

fail.text: You duck away, and step straight into another pair of eyes. Hiding becomes its own crime.

name: A Risky Loan
prompt: A moneylender offers you coin with a smile too wide. "No shame," he says.

outcomes.title: Take the Loan
outcomes.desc: Coin now. Consequences later.

success.text: You sign. Coin changes hands.

fail.text: You sign, and the terms shift as you do. By the time you notice, you're already deeper than you meant to be.

outcomes.title: Walk Away
outcomes.desc: Some offers are traps made of kindness.

success.text: You refuse and keep your name your own. It doesn't solve your lack of coin, but it keeps you from kneeling to it.

fail.text: You refuse, and the moneylender laughs. "You'll be back," he says, and the laugh follows you down the street.

outcomes.title: Negotiate the Terms
outcomes.desc: Change the shape of the trap so you can see the teeth.

success.text: You rewrite the bargain until it is merely dangerous, not fatal. You take coin, and keep a measure of control.

fail.text: You try to outtalk a professional. He lets you try.

name: Whispers at the Market
prompt: People look at you a beat too long, then pretend they weren't. The rumor has traveled ahead of you and set up a stall.

outcomes.title: Confront the Whisperer
outcomes.desc: Pick a target and make them regret speaking.

success.text: You make the whisperer flinch, and the flinch tells a story louder than words. The rumor loses momentum.

fail.text: You grab the wrong person. Now the rumor has proof to cling to.

outcomes.title: Do a Public Kindness
outcomes.desc: Let your actions drown out their words.

success.text: You pay for a stranger’s medicine. You carry a basket for an old man.

fail.text: You try to be seen being kind, and it reads as performance. The market shrugs and moves on, leaving you where you started.

outcomes.title: Lean Into It
outcomes.desc: If they want a villain, give them a better one, on your terms.

success.text: You smile at the stares and let them build their own myths. In the shadows, you learn who profits from your bad name.

fail.text: You play the villain and attract the wrong kind of attention. Someone decides you’re worth watching closely.

name: The Apology Rite
prompt: An elder of the Lantern Order offers a rite of apology, salt, water, and a public admission. It won't erase the rumor, but it can change its flavor.

outcomes.title: Submit to the Rite
outcomes.desc: Speak the words and let the crowd take what it wants.

success.text: You kneel, you speak, you accept the sting. The crowd exhales.

fail.text: You try, and your pride ruins the cadence. The elder sighs.

outcomes.title: Offer a Donation Instead
outcomes.desc: Let coin stand in for contrition.

success.text: The elder accepts your coin without smiling. "It helps," she says, which is the closest thing to forgiveness you get today.
